record.id: field.name=NULL and file.name="cm3rcategory" and term="Change category table" and format.name="cm3rcategory" and syslanguage="en"
record.recordid: cm3rcategory - Change category table - cm3rcategory - en
record.file.name: cm3rcategory
record.format.name: cm3rcategory

brief.brief: The Change category table stores valid categories, approvals required for the Category, the system affected, and the reviewer classes authorized to review change documents for the Category.

detail.detail: To update a Change category record in the Change category table, first press F2 (Change category table) from the Change Management Menu, or enter the appropriate string command on any Command line and press Enter.
Enter the Change category name you want to update, or press Enter to choose the Category from a list of records.
To add a new category to the Change category table, first press F6 (Create New Change category) and enter the new category name. Format Manager displays a blank screen.
Using only the top five lines, paint the format of the middle section for the Category.
Press F1 to add the new format.
Make any updates necessary and press F2 (Update) and then press Enter.
Service Manager displays the Change category table format and defaults certain fields.
Complete the Change category record for the new Change category and press F1 (Add) to save it.
Once you have added the new Change category record, Service Manager displays the Approval Group so that you can add or update an approval group.
Press F1 (Add) to add the approval group record.
